medical_conditions.diagnosis: Degenerative disease of nervous system, unspecified
medical_conditions.code_explanation: Provider documented 'Mild cerebral atrophy' in progress notes on 04/18/2025 and 12/19/2024. Supported by MRI Brain findings from 05/29/2024 showing 'mild diffuse volume loss with extensive white matter changes on FLAIR and T2-weighted sequences in the periventricular white matter and subcortical white matter bilaterally.'
medical_conditions.query: Suggestion: Cerebral volume loss as per imaging report MRI Brain dated 05/29/2024. Please review for clinical correlation and document cerebral atrophy, if appropriate. Although a certain amount of volume loss is normal with the aging process, it can lead to increased risk of sensoryneuro problems effecting the patient and family. The plan of care would include monitoring for mood changes, memory problems, balance or mobility issues, changes in personality, and any other indication of sensoryneuro problems.
medical_conditions.clinical_indicators: MRI Brain (05/29/2024) showing mild diffuse volume loss, extensive white matter changes on FLAIR and T2-weighted sequences, Previous CT Brain (11/12/2022) showing 'small vessel ischemic/degenerative changes', MRI Brain (11/13/2022) showing 'large burden of white matter disease in the supratentorial white matter'
medical_conditions.condition_name: Degenerative disease of nervous system, unspecified

medical_conditions.diagnosis: Unspecified dementia, unspecified severity, without behavioral disturbance, psychotic disturbance, mood disturbance, and anxiety
medical_conditions.code_explanation: Provider documented 'Mild cerebral atrophy' in progress notes on 04/18/2025 and 12/19/2024. MRI Brain from 05/29/2024 shows 'mild diffuse volume loss with extensive white matter changes' which can be associated with cognitive impairment and dementia. The extensive white matter changes on imaging suggest potential cognitive effects that may warrant evaluation for dementia.
medical_conditions.query: [V28] Suggestion: Brain Atrophy as per imaging report MRI Brain dated 05/29/2024. Please review for clinical correlation with Dementia and document if appropriate. Although a certain amount of cerebral atrophy is normal with the aging process, it can lead to increased risk of sensoryneuro and cognitive problems effecting the patient and family. The plan of care would include monitoring for mood changes, memory problems, balance or mobility issues, changes in personality, and any other indication of sensoryneuro problems.
medical_conditions.clinical_indicators: MRI Brain (05/29/2024) showing mild diffuse volume loss with extensive white matter changes, Previous CT Brain (11/12/2022) showing 'small vessel ischemic/degenerative changes', MRI Brain (11/13/2022) showing 'large burden of white matter disease in the supratentorial white matter'

medical_conditions.code_explanation: Provider documented both 'Coronary artery disease' and 'Angina pectoris' separately across multiple encounters.
